column2: MA DMV PRACTICE TEST
column4: Massachusetts
column6: MA

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. You must pull over to the edge of the road and allow an emergency vehicle to pass:
column4: only if the emergency vehicle is approaching.
column6: only if the emergency vehicle is following you.
column8: regardless of your direction.

column2: 2. When drivers come to this sign, they must:
column4: be ready to stop at the stop sign.
column6: warn other drivers that a stop sign is ahead.
column8: brake sharply and come to a complete stop.
column10: stop doing what they are doing.

column2: 3. If you drink alcohol socially, what helps insure safe driving?
column4: Drink coffee before driving.
column6: Take a cold shower before driving.
column8: Stop drinking one hour before driving.
column10: Ride home with a friend who has not been drinking.

column2: 4. Before turning, you should:
column4: change lanes.
column6: sound your horn to alert the other drivers.
column8: increase your speed.

column2: 5. What does a yellow arrow signal mean?
column4: The same as the yellow light, but applies only to movement in the direction of the arrow.
column6: The same as a green light.
column8: Vehicles moving in all directions must stop if they can. The light will soon be red.

column2: 6. This road sign means:
column4: No Passing Zone
column6: One-way street ahead
column8: Railroad Warning

column2: 7. This sign means:
column4: Parking is not allowed at 8:30 AM and at 5:30 PM
column6: No parking between 8:30 AM and 5:30 PM.
column8: You can only park between 8:30 AM and 5:30 PM.

column2: 8. Which shape is a warning sign?
column4: Round
column6: Diamond
column8: Triangle

column2: 9. You are entering a roadway from a private road, and you need to turn left. You have to yield to:
column4: pedestrians only.
column6: vehicles from the right.
column8: vehicles from the left.

column2: 10. This road sign means:
column4: Stop for other traffic
column6: Yield right-of-way
column8: Lane shifting
column10: Traffic is entering from another road, drive with caution

column2: 11. When drivers see the ‘Wrong Way’ sign:
column4: they are going the wrong way on an expressway exit ramp.
column6: they must stop immediately.
column8: they must drive past this sign and reach the next intersection.
column10: they must not leave the pavement except in an emergency.

column2: 12. A traffic sign with a red circle around and a slash over a symbol means:
column4: the maneuver shown on the sign should be executed with extreme caution.
column6: the maneuver shown on the sign can be executed only after coming to a complete stop.
column8: the maneuver shown by the symbol is not allowed.
column10: Do not drive faster than the posted speed limit.

column2: 13. Which of the following does NOT affect the distance that it takes to stop your vehicle?
column4: Reaction distance.
column6: Steering ability.
column8: Perception time.

column2: 14. In the following situations, drivers should increase their following interval:
column4: On slippery roads.
column6: When it is hard to see ahead because of bad weather.
column8: When following vehicles that are required to come to a stop at railroad crossings.

column2: 15. Your brake lights tell other drivers that you:
column4: are slowing down or stopping.
column6: are changing lanes.
column8: are making a turn.

column2: 16. Doing all you can to prevent crashes is called:
column4: ABS Driving
column6: Anti-Collision Driving
column8: Crash-Prevention Driving

column2: 17. Alcohol:
column4: makes it difficult for drivers to judge their condition.
column6: increases reaction time.
column8: makes drivers more prone to take chances.

column2: 18. When driving near light rail vehicles, drivers should:
column4: expect trains on any track at any time.
column6: never drive around lowered crossing gates.
column8: always obey signs and traffic signals.

column2: 19. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: there is a winding road ahead.
column6: there is a low place in the road.
column8: there is a double curve ahead.
column10: the highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways. Drivers should keep to the right.

column2: 20. This road sign means:
column4: Right turn is not permitted
column6: No U-turns
column8: A left turn can be made only after stopping
column10: All traffic must turn right at the next intersection

column2: 21. If another vehicle is approaching you head-on in your lane, you should _______, sound your horn and brake.
column4: stay in the center of your lane
column6: steer left
column8: None of the other answers is correct.

column2: 22. A driver who approaches an intersection:
column4: has the right-of-way over traffic already in the intersection.
column6: must drive straight through the intersection, even if another vehicle is already in the intersection.
column8: must yield the right-of-way to traffic already in the intersection.

column2: 23. Passing is prohibited:
column4: when a school bus is stopped to load or unload children on a public road.
column6: whenever a solid line marks the left side of your lane.
column8: at intersections.

column2: 24. The sign in the picture:
column4: is a Construction and Maintenance Traffic Control sign.
column6: is found at most intersections and indicates that drivers must yield to other vehicles.
column8: is displayed on the rear of slow moving vehicles.
column10: means that you need to stop.

column2: 25. This sign means:
column4: The traffic signal ahead is out of order
column6: you must yield to the traffic signal ahead.
column8: Traffic signal ahead
